heroSubtitle: Use Claude Code directly in your web browser with a powerful terminal interface
step0Description: Make sure you have Claude CLI installed locally and have your authentication credentials ready
step0Code:
# Check if Claude CLI is installed
claude --version

# If not installed, follow: https://docs.anthropic.com/claude/docs/claude-cli
step1Description: Create a .env file in your project root with the following configuration
step1Code:
# Claude CLI Configuration (Optional)
CLAUDE_PATH=claude
WORK_DIR=/path/to/your/project

# Anthropic API Configuration (Required)
ANTHROPIC_BASE_URL=http://your-api-url:3000/api
ANTHROPIC_AUTH_TOKEN=your_auth_token_here

# Claude Model Configuration (Optional)
ANTHROPIC_MODEL=claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929
ANTHROPIC_SMALL_FAST_MODEL=claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929

# Server Configuration (Optional)
PORT=4000
HOST=0.0.0.0
step2Description: Install the webcc CLI tool globally using npm and start the web interface
step3Description: Open your browser and navigate to http://localhost:4000. You can now interact with Claude Code directly in your browser with a powerful web-based terminal interface
footer: Built with ❤️ for developers | Open Source on GitHub
loginDescription: Sign in to save your work and access your projects from anywhere
termsNotice: By continuing, you agree to our Terms of Service and Privacy Policy
